Package Steganography.Logic

Class ImageSteganography

  • java.lang.Object
    • Steganography.Logic.BaseSteganography
      • Steganography.Logic.ImageSteganography
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageInImageSteganography

    public class ImageSteganography
extends BaseSteganography
    The ImageSteganography class handles the steganographic process for 24-bit, RGB Bitmap images using the Least Significant Bit (LSB) method.

    Image formats supported for encoding: png, bmp, jpg.

    Image formats supported for decoding: png, bmp.

    One byte can be hidden in either 1 pixel of the image (for maximum capacity) or 2 pixels (for minimum effect on the image).

    See Also:
    BaseSteganography

        isEncrypted - whether the data to embed is encrypted
        isCompressed - whether the data to embed is compressed
        pixelsPerByte - encoding mode (1 or 2 pixels/byte)
        Throws:

      • encode

        public void encode​(byte[] message,
                   java.io.File output)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   CannotEncodeException
        Calls BaseSteganography.setHeader(byte[]) to write the message header to the stego image, then encodes the message to hide using hideByte(byte, int, int, byte) byte by byte, then saves the stego image.
        Specified by:
        encode in class BaseSteganography
        Parameters:
        message - message to embed in the cover image
        output - stego image with the embedded message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when creating the stego image.
        CannotEncodeException - if the message is empty or larger than maximum capacity.

      • decode

        public void decode​(java.io.File file)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   CannotDecodeException
        Extracts the header from the stego image to create the BaseSteganography.secretInfo field, then decodes the hidden data in the image using revealByte(int, int, byte), then saves the secret file.
        Specified by:
        decode in class BaseSteganography
        Parameters:
        file - destination of the embedded data in the stego image
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing hidden data to the file.
        CannotDecodeException - if there is no data embedded in the stego image.

      • embed

        private void embed​(byte b,
                   int i,
                   int j,
                   byte pixelsPerByte)
        Hides one byte in one pixels inside the least significant bits of the pixel colors.

        The pixelsPerByte parameter defines the encoding behaviour:

        • if pixelsPerByte == 1: The 8 bits that form the byte are hidden inside the 3 LSBs of red, 2 in the 2 LSBs of green, and 3 in the 3 LSBs of blue
        • if pixelsPerByte == 2: The 4 bits to hide from the 8 bits that form the byte are hidden inside the LSB of red, 2 in the 2 LSBs of green, and in the LSB of blue
        Parameters:
        b - byte to hide in the pixel
        i - x-index of the cover image pixel
        j - y-index of the cover image pixel
        pixelsPerByte - encoding mode

      • hideByte

        private void hideByte​(byte b,
                      int i,
                      int j,
                      byte pixelsPerByte)
        Hides one byte using embed(byte, int, int, byte).

        The pixelsPerByte parameter defines the encoding behaviour:

        • if pixelsPerByte == 1: we hide the byte in the pixel of the cover image at the index i,j
        • if pixelsPerByte == 1: we hide the 4 most significant bits of the byte in the pixel (i, j) of the cover image and then we perform a left shift of 4 bits to the byte and we hide the 4 least significant bits of the byte in the opposite pixel of the cover image (height-1-i, width-1-j)
        Parameters:
        b - byte to hide in the pixel(s)
        i - x-index of the cover image pixel
        j - y-index of the cover image pixel
        pixelsPerByte - encoding mode

      • extract

        private byte extract​(int i,
                     int j,
                     byte pixelsPerByte)
        Reveals one byte hidden inside the (i, j) pixel.

        The pixelsPerByte parameter defines the decoding behaviour:

        • if pixelsPerByte == 1: We extract the 3 LSBs in red, 2 LSBs in green and 3 LSBs in blue to form the byte
        • if pixelsPerByte == 2: We extract the LSB in red, 2 LSBs in green and LSB in blue to form the byte
        Parameters:
        i - x-index of the stego image pixel
        j - y-index of the stego image pixel
        pixelsPerByte - decoding mode
        Returns:
        the embedded byte in stego image pixel (i, j).

      • revealByte

        private byte revealByte​(int i,
                        int j,
                        byte pixelsPerByte)
        Reveals one byte using extract(int, int, byte).

        The pixelsPerByte parameter defines the decoding behaviour:

        • if pixelsPerByte == 1: We extract the byte in pixel (i, j)
        • if pixelsPerByte == 2: We extract the 4 MSBs of the byte in pixel (i, j) and then the 4 LSBs of the byte in pixel (height-1-i, width-1-j)
        Parameters:
        i - x-index of the stego image pixel
        j - y-index of the stego image pixel
        pixelsPerByte - decoding mode
        Returns:
        the embedded byte in stego image.
